place.name: LLANSADURNEN
place.gazetteerText: LLANSADWRNEN, a parish in the district and county of Carmarthen; on Carmarthen bay, 1½ mile SW of Laugharne, and 5 S by E of St. Clears r. station. Post town, Laugharne, under St. Clears. Acres, 1,644; of which 150 are water. Real property, £1.265. Pop., 194. Houses, 35. The property is divided among a few. Limestone is worked. The living is a rectory, annexed to the vicarage of Laugharne, in the diocese of St. David's. The church was rebuilt in 1861; is in the decorated English style; and consists of nave and chancel, with vestry and tower. Judge Powell, who tried the seven bishops, resided at Broadway, now a ruin. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
